radiofeed.feedparser.converters module¶

radiofeed.feedparser.converters.duration(value)¶

Given a duration value will ensure all values fall within range.

Examples:

  • 3600 (plain int) -> “3600”

  • 3:60:50:1000 -> “3:60:50”

Return empty string if cannot resolve.

Parameters:

value (str | None) –

Returns:

str

radiofeed.feedparser.converters.explicit(value)¶

Checks if podcast or episode explicit

Parameters:

value (str | None) –

Returns:

bool

radiofeed.feedparser.converters.url(value)¶

Returns a URL value. Will try to prefix with https:// if only domain provided.

If cannot resolve as a valid URL will return None.

Parameters:

value (str | None) –

Returns:

str | None

radiofeed.feedparser.feed_parser module¶

class radiofeed.feedparser.feed_parser.FeedParser(podcast)¶

Bases: object

Updates a Podcast instance with its RSS or Atom feed source.

Parameters:

podcast (Podcast) –

episodes_for_insert(feed, guids)¶
episodes_for_update(feed, guids)¶
extract_text(feed, categories, keywords)¶
get_feed_headers()¶
handle_failure(exc)¶
handle_success(response, feed, content_hash)¶
make_episode(item, episode_id=None)¶
parse()¶

Updates Podcast instance with RSS or Atom feed source. Podcast details are updated and episodes created, updated or deleted accordingly.

If a podcast is discontinued (e.g. there is a duplicate feed in the database, or the feed is marked as complete) then the podcast is set inactive.

Returns:

if podcast has been successfully updated. This will be False if there are no updates or

there is some other problem e.g. HTTP error.

Return type:

bool

parse_rss()¶
save_episodes(feed, batch_size=100)¶

Remove any episodes no longer in feed, update any current and add new

radiofeed.feedparser.rss_parser.parse_rss(content)¶

Parses RSS or Atom feed and returns the feed details and individual episodes.

Parameters:

content (bytes) – the body of the RSS or Atom feed

Returns:

Feed

Raises:

RssParserError – if XML content is invalid, or the feed is otherwise invalid or empty
